snippet: Port Authority officials are divided as some argue against subsidizing another office tower that would compete with the authority’s own half-empty one.
abstract: Port Authority officials are sharply divided over whether to double level of subsidies and support for 3 World Trade Center, long-stalled office tower proposed by developer Larry A Silverstein; proponents contend that tower will mark completion of new trade center, while critics argue against subsidizing another office tower that will compete with authority’s own half-empty one, One World Trade Center.
lead_paragraph: Port Authority officials are divided as some argue against subsidizing another office tower that would compete with the authority’s own half-empty one.

headline.main: Developer’s Skyscraper Is Focus of Latest Dispute at Rebuilt Trade Center
headline.print_headline: Developer’s Skyscraper Is Focus of Latest Dispute at Rebuilt Trade Center

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
